title: Where did this lag come from?
body:
Can someone please explain to me what it happening with the servers? 

I am running 500mb internet speed currently and after running multiple tests on different devices and games and talking with my ISP I have confirmed that everything is running smoothly on my end. I know the servers were attacked last week but what is causing the ping spikes now? I have not got into a game yet that I have been under 300 ping. It goes from 300-2k ping and I have heard the same thing going on with other people as well.

replies.body:
It sounds like there may be issues going on with your network routing to the server. Network speeds won't directly affect this, and there are a lot of factors that go into your latency to a server and whether your packets consistently get there or not. We can take a look at your routing to the server after you've ensured your network settings are aligned with those listed in our [connection troubleshooting guide.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)

Let me know if you have any questions.

I have done all of the steps in the troubleshooting. I am downloading the repair tool to see if that works. What should I do if nothing else works? Also why would other people be having problems if it was something on my end?

Other people could be having similar problems if their connection takes similar hops to the server. If there are problematic nodes, they could affect more than one player or ISP. 

Let's take a look at your route to find where the issue may be. I'd like you to grab a tool called [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/) to complete the traceroute we'll be running. After booting up the app, plug in 104.160.131.1 for the host IP, then start the trace. After it has run for 5 minutes, export the results as text and paste them in a response to this post.

Let me know if you need me to clarify anything.

Hey there, I'm having issues too, except that I am getting huge spikes from time to time. I sit around 40-50 ping for some amount of time - ranging from 30 minutes, to 30 seconds - only to get interrupted by pingspikes; sometimes up to 80, sometimes up to 60, sometimes 500 and even 5000. I have done multiple tests, and talked with my ISP, only to do some settings configuration - and then have no improvement. The tests that Riot told me to run said that I was experiencing some bad packet loss and bandwith issues, but those seem to come and go, and are nearly independent of my spikes; I've had 30 ping in the red of the test, and 5000 ping when it all comes back green. This is all very frustrating to me, too.
